Detailed Description

KeyManager exclusively receives all messages in an application and applies potential key mappings to key down messages according to the active context description.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

static KeyManager& KeyManager::GetInstance (   )  [inline, static]
 

BOOLEAN KeyManager::HandleMessage (  const Message &  msg,
AtlApplication *  parent
) 
 

Is invoked in AtlApplication::RoutMessage. It checks whether the key-message has a defined keymapping in the current context. If the key has a defined keymapping a new key message is sent otherwise the "old" keymessage is routed via RouteMessage()

Parameters:
msg Message to be checked, if key mappings must be applied
parent Parent application of the message, which may be needed for updating context items, if a key mapping contains context features
See also:
KeyMapping

static void KeyManager::SwallowKey (  KeyCode  key_code  )  [inline, static]
 

Emulated keys must not be propagated to user activity listeners and must not play key tones eg. key press is mapped to a TriggerKeyFeature, emulated key messages should not play key tone.
